metadata.title: B2 Gap-Fill Set 03 - Advanced Format
metadata.description: 2000s Cambridge format with 15 gaps per text - includes advanced auxiliary verbs, gerunds, infinitives, and complex preposition patterns

sentences.q: The navigation instinct is what makes certain creatures, birds and amphibians return _____ the place they consider home.
The place they identify _____ home.
Felines frequently display _____ behavior.
Cats often have this instinct. It was particularly strong in an American cat called Ninja, which disappeared shortly _____ its owners had taken it to their new home.
Its owners had transported it _____ their new residence.
Twelve months later the cat appeared _____ its previous home.
The cat appeared at its previous home even _____ this was 1,360 kilometres away from where its owners were now living.
1,360 kilometres away _____ where its owners were currently living.
Other cats may _____ travel so far but many keep on going back to their old home.
But many _____ on going back to their old home.
Pilsbury completed a 13-kilometre trek back _____ its former home.
Pilsbury, an English cat, made a 13-kilometre journey back to its former home 40 times in spite _____ having to cross several busy roads to do so.
Despite _____ to cross several busy roads.
Pigeons also have the homing instinct and, over _____ centuries, human beings have used them to carry messages back home.
However, cat owners, _____ have to keep returning to their old address in order to bring their cat home, tend to find the homing instinct simply irritating.
Folding bicycles have _____ around for quite some time now.
For quite _____ considerable time now.
However, an amazing new Japanese version _____ be folded with a swiftness and efficiency never seen before.

It is designed in such a way that it is possible _____ fold it up quickly.

This remarkable bike has a half-folding frame _____ a hinge in the middle.
And, although the basic idea is _____ original, its inventor has created an especially clever variation.
Its inventor has created an especially clever variation, combining compactness _____ convenience with smart design.
Recently, folding bicycles _____ become very popular in Japan, particularly in congested urban areas like Tokyo.
Particularly in congested urban areas _____ Tokyo.
Tokyo is a city _____ every square centimetre of space is in great demand.
Japanese cyclists need to be able to store their bikes in tiny areas at home or the office. And _____ they should want to take their bicycle on the underground, a folding model is a big advantage.
If they should want _____ take their bicycle on the underground.
A folding model is a big advantage _____ they want to take their bicycle on the underground.
In the last few years, a number of cookery schools have been set _____ in Ireland to promote Irish cooking.
_____ such school is run by Kathleen Doyle.
One such school is run by Kathleen Doyle not _____ from the centre of Dublin.
'I opened the school twelve years ago,' says Kathleen. 'The school was by no _____ an overnight success.'
'The school was by no means an overnight success; I found _____ necessary to work hard to build up a reputation.'
I found it necessary to work hard _____ build up a reputation.
'One of my advantages was that I'd had problems with my own cooking. I've made _____ mistake that it's possible to make.'
I've made every mistake that it's possible to make, but _____ of this, I know what people do wrong from first-hand experience.
Just _____ most cookery schools in Ireland, Kathleen initially copied the classical dishes of France and Italy.
Kathleen initially copied the classical dishes _____ France and Italy.
Dishes of France and Italy and other countries _____ have a reputation for excellent food.
'Now though, things are changing,' says Kathleen. 'We get excellent produce from Irish farms and, _____ a result, we're encouraging students to create unique Irish dishes.'
We're encouraging students _____ create unique Irish dishes.
We're encouraging students to create unique Irish dishes _____ reflect our heritage.
Just like most cookery schools in Ireland, Kathleen _____ copied the classical dishes of France.
